ISRO chief explains why students need more than just marks
description: ISRO chief V Narayanan has warned that India cannot afford to produce “mere bookworms”, backing value-based education and social–emotional learning over a marks-only culture. Linking his views with NEP 2020, OECD and WEF data, we argue that traits like self-control, respect, empathy and resilience shape employability, well-being and citizenship far more deeply than exam scores alone for today’s students.

description: The minerals, calcium, potassium and magnesium present in milk help blood vessels relax, while maintaining proper fluid equilibrium. The cardiovascular system experiences reduced pressure because of these effects, which also enhance artery flexibility

description: Smriti Mandhana's wedding to Palash Muchhal has been indefinitely postponed due to her father's sudden hospitalisation.  Palak Muchhal confirmed the sensitive situation, requesting privacy.  Both Smriti's father and fiancé were hospitalised, though Palash has since been discharged.  The family is focused on Mr Mandhana's recovery, with his condition stable but requiring observation.

title: Dharmendra redefined the role of the hero: Devendra Fadnavis
This blood type may raise the risk of fatal liver disease, new study finds
description: New research links blood type A to a higher risk of autoimmune liver diseases. Individuals with blood type B may face a lower risk, particularly for primary biliary cholangitis. Autoimmune liver disease occurs when the body's immune system attacks the liver. While blood type is a factor, lifestyle choices and regular check-ups remain crucial for liver health.

description: Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff has declared his switch from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0. He experienced a significant shift after using Google's latest AI model. Benioff highlighted Gemini 3's improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This move signals intense competition in the AI landscape, with other tech leaders acknowledging Gemini 3's success.

description: The Election Commission is addressing work-related stress among Booth Level Officers (BLOs) during Kerala's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls after an audio message went viral. This follows reports of BLO suicides and deaths due to excessive pressure in several states, prompting protests and criticism from political parties regarding the rushed and opaque nature of the revision process.

The protest, initially against air pollution, saw demonstrators holding posters of Madvi Hidma, leading to arrests by Delhi Police for obstructing personnel and assaulting them.

Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; outlets face closure risk
description: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

title: Tom Brady’s on-air slip? Viral Cowboys-Eagles clip triggers debate online
description: Tom Brady stumbled over a player's name during a live broadcast of the Dallas Cowboys versus Philadelphia Eagles game. The incident occurred in the final minutes of the match. Social media users reacted to the verbal mix-up. Brady is in his second season as a commentator for FOX. The game itself saw Dallas achieve a historic comeback victory.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
description: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: OpenAI's internal memo: Altman notes Google’s AI success; calls it 'temporary headwind'
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.
